chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant KARRIE A OKON was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: OKON, KARRIE A
defendant.address: 685 S Waupaca St Apt 12, Wautoma, WI 54982

records.addlTxt:
1:52 PM Defendant KARRIE A OKON in court.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis in court for KARRIE A OKON.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Kapelis confirms an agreement was reached. ADA recites agreement - will amend count 1 to to misdemeanor possession of THC with a fine and costs and will plea to count 4 with costs and defense is free to argue and counts 2 & 3 will be dismissed and read-in. Statement by Atty Kapelis, the agreement was to plea to the amended count 1 and the balance of the counts will be dismissed and read-in as the defendant has obtained a valid driver's license. Statement by ADA McElroy - concurs, the agreement is correct, defendant will plea to the amended count 1 and the balance of the counts will be dismissed and read-in. Defendant concurs, ADA moves to amend count 1 to misdemeanor possession of THC in violation of 961.41(3g)(e). Court grants the amendment.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant. Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights. Court goes over the elements of each offense. Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty. Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. 

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST. Court orders counts 2,3 & 4 be dismissed and read-in. Court finds the plea is made knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently. Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea. Court finds the defendant guilty on the amended count 1. Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today. Sentencing statement by ADA. Sentencing statement by Atty Kapelis. No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-$250 fine plus costs. Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or call the Clerk of Courts Office (920-294-4142) to set-up a payment plan. 
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample. 

Court adjourned at 2:04 PM
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 23, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

2:38 PM Defendant KARRIE A OKON appeared by video.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis appeared by video for KARRIE A OKON.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Kapelis states he has the Discovery and requests a plea & sentencing. Court sets for Plea & sentencing on August 23, 2022 at 1:45 PM. In-person.

Court adjourned at 2:40 PM
Status hearing on July 19, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

records.addlTxt:
2:49 PM Defendant KARRIE A OKON in court.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis in court for KARRIE A OKON.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Kapelis states the defendant is requesting a substitution of judge. Defendant has no objection to holding the arraignment today.. Atty Kapelis acknowledges receipt of the information and waives any reading. Atty Kapelis enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant. Court grants the request for substitution. Atty Kapelis to put the request in writing.

Court adjourned at 2:51 PM

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
4:08 PM Defendant KARRIE A OKON in court.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis in court for KARRIE A OKON.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Statement by ADA McElroy - has one witness.

Taylor Wallace sworn, direct by ADA McElroy, is employed as a Patrol Deputy for the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department. Was employed on the date in question. Venue established. Testimony given. Identified the defendant present in court. ADA requests the Court take judicial notice of 2019CM70. Court takes judicial notice, defendant was found guilty. Cross exam by Atty Kapelis. State rests. Atty Kapelis has no witnesses. Statement by the Court. Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony has been committed and that the felony probably was committed by the defendant and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files the information - same as the criminal complaint. Atty Kapelis requests an arraignment be scheduled.

Court adjourned at 4:18 PM

Court will set for Arraignment on June 7, 2022 at 2:45 PM.
Arraignment scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.
Preliminary hearing on May 9, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

9:13 AM Defendant KARRIE A OKON in court.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis in court for KARRIE A OKON.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Kapelis confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading and requests a preliminary hearing. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. ADA McElroy makes bond recommendation. Court sets bond at $500 signature bond and conditions of: Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department. Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant does not waive the time limits. 

Court adjourned at 9:15 AM.

Court will set for Preliminary Hearing on May 09, 2022 at 3:30 PM.
